drinkName.name: Queen Rose
drinkName.about: Absolut Vodka and the bitter aperitif Aperol combine to make this complex, citrusy cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with an orange wheel. .

drinkName.name: Frosty Mule
drinkName.about: Yellow Chartreuse adds extra spice to this classic ginger-and-vodka cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a copper mug filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Kamikaze
drinkName.about: The Kamikaze was designed to cut to the chase. Invented on an American naval base in Japan after World War II and made popular during the great reign of vodka of the 1970s and ’80s, the Kamikaze isn’t the kind of cocktail bartenders sit around contemplating in hushed, reverent tones.

mix.how: Makes 2 shots.
Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice, and shake thoroughly until well-chilled.
Double-strain into two shot glasses.

drinkName.name: Piña Colada
drinkName.about: The Piña Colada is a classic tropical cocktail with rum, pineapple and coconut milk. This classic recipe will transport you to paradise. Getting caught in the rain is not required.

mix.how: To make the Piña Colada add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Hurricane glass filled with fresh ice.
(You may also blend all the ingredients with crushed ice instead.) Garnish with a cherry and a pineapple wedge.

drinkName.name: Whiskey Sour
drinkName.about: The Whiskey Sour is one classic cocktail that won’t make you sour.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (1 part water, 1 part sugar)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a cherry and lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: D’USSÉ Angel’s Shoulder
drinkName.about: This complex cognac cocktail might just become your new favorite drink.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube.
Top with a red wine float.

drinkName.name: D’USSÉ Motown
drinkName.about: One sip of this cognac-based sipper and you’ll be dancing the night away to your favorite Motown tunes.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a slice of lemon peel.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (3 parts honey, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add one-quarter of a golden apple to a shaker and muddle to extract the juices.
Add remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into double Old Fashioned glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with apple fan.

drinkName.name: The Swindle
drinkName.about: Don’t worry; you won’t be swindled out of a great night if you have this riff on the traditional Whiskey Sour in hand.

mix.how: Add bourbon, simple syrup and fresh lemon juice to a Collins glass filled with crushed ice.
Top with bitters and garnish with mint. .

drinkName.name: Pressing Charges
drinkName.about: This bourbon cocktail will get you out of any sticky situation.

mix.how: Add bourbon, ginger ale and soda water to an old fashioned glass and fill with ice.
Float bitters on top.

drinkName.name: The Lock Pick
drinkName.about: This iced tea-and-bourbon cocktail is the key to great night.

mix.how: Add bourbon, PAMA and lemon juice to a Collins glass and fill with ice.
Top with the tea (and simple syrup, if necessary) and garnish with a lemon slice.

drinkName.name: 5 to 10
drinkName.about: This riff on the classic Manhattan will make you feel like you’re up to no good.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Smoky Sour
drinkName.about: This tantalizing cocktail is a smoky and frothy twist on the traditional Whiskey Sour.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake for 10 seconds until drink is frothy, and strain into a coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Creole Crusta
drinkName.about: For football season, we have presented a drink by a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown. Bartender Alba Huerta is a major player in the Houston eating and drinking scene (Anvil, Julep, The Pastry War) and reps hometown pride for the Houston Texans with this chile-flake-infused cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Chile-flake-infused Clement Créole Shrubb orange liqueur
Turbinado sugar syrup (2 parts sugar, 1 part water)

mix.how: Mix together the turbinado sugar and toasted benne seeds.
Coat the rim of a cocktail glass with lemon juice, and coat it in the sugar and seed mixture.
Add remaining ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake.
Double-strain into the rimmed cocktail glass, and garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Silver Cloud
drinkName.about: Lavender, peach and gin makes this cocktail perfect for any sunny day.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and dry shake.
Add ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with a sprig of dried lavender.

drinkName.name: Classic Bijou
drinkName.about: This classic gin drink, named for the French word for “jewel,” will put a twinkle in your eye.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Basil Hayden’s Maple Sour
drinkName.about: This unique twist on a Whiskey Sour uses maple syrup, port and Bittermens Molé Bitters.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a double Old Fashioned glass with ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a cherry.

drinkName.name: Bijou
drinkName.about: This boozy classic is named for the French word for jewel.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Tarragon Simple Syrup
drinkName.about: This garden-fresh simple syrup recipe will add a hint of tarragon to your favorite cocktails.

mix.how: Combine the sugar and boiling water.
Stir until the sugar is dissolved.
Add the tarragon leaves and steep in hot simple syrup for 20 minutes.
Strain into a clean jar, cover and refrigerate for up to two weeks.

drinkName.name: Mint Simple Syrup
drinkName.about: This garden-fresh simple syrup recipe will add a refreshing hit of mint to your favorite cocktails.

mix.how: Combine the sugar and mint in a bowl.
Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved.
Steep the mint leaves for 15 minutes.
Strain into a jar, cover and refrigerate for up to two weeks.

drinkName.name: Basil Simple Syrup
drinkName.about: This garden-fresh simple syrup recipe will add a hint of basil to your favorite cocktails.

mix.how: Combine the sugar and boiling water.
Stir until the sugar is dissolved.
Add the basil leaves and steep in hot simple syrup for 15 minutes.
Strain into a clean jar, cover and refrigerate for up to two weeks.

drinkName.name: Green Derby
drinkName.about: This Rocky Mountain variation on the traditional Brown Derby recipe combines TINCUP Whiskey and grapefruit juice.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Jewel Mine
drinkName.about: This sweet and tart cocktail is made with a blend of whiskey and pomegranate liqueur.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients except for the tonic water in a rocks glass.
Fill with ice and top with tonic water.
Garnish with a cucumber wheel.

drinkName.name: Rocky Manhattan
drinkName.about: Try this fresh take on the timeless Manhattan.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a rocks glass and fill with ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Amsterdam 75
drinkName.about: Swap gin for genever to get this twist on the classic French 75.

mix.how: Add genever, simple syrup and lemon juice to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with Champagne or sparkling wine and garnish with a lemon twist if desired.

drinkName.name: VEEV Collins
drinkName.about: Give the classic Collins cocktail an update with a measure of VEEV Spirit.

mix.how: Add VEEV, lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass.
Fill glass with ice and top with the soda.
Garnish with a lemon wedge and mint sprig.

drinkName.name: VEEV Greyhound
drinkName.about: Think a Greyhound is just grapefruit juice and gin? Think again.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

drinkName.name: Martini 2.0
drinkName.about: A twist on the classic.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Express orange and lemon oils over the drink and garnish with the peels.

drinkName.name: Revive Lemonade
drinkName.about: Take your boozy lemonade to the next level.

mix.how: Muddle ginger in cocktail shaker.
Add all other ingredients and fill shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass.
Fill glass with fresh ice and garnish with ginger candy or lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Martinez
drinkName.about: This classic recipe first appeared in O.H. Byron’s 1884 “Modern Bartenders’ Guide.”

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Courvoisier Smash
drinkName.about: This cognac cocktail is as easy-to-make as it is delicious.

mix.how: Muddle the mint and lemon in a highball glass, then fill with ice.
Add the cognac and mint syrup.
Stir, and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: An Afternoon in France
drinkName.about: A bit of honey syrup is the secret to this summer cognac and citrus punch.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (one part honey, one part water)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube.
Garnish with grapefruit and a lemon twists.

drinkName.name: Por Mi Amante
drinkName.about: Strawberry-infused rum is a must in this summer cocktail with just a hint of spice.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: El Chapo
drinkName.about: You’ve never had a strawberry cocktail like this before.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice.
Top with Stiegl Radler Grapefruit Beer and garnish with 2 speared fresh strawberry slices.

drinkName.name: Wild Strawberry Amaro
drinkName.about: You’ll gain a new appreciation for amaro in this cocktail with hints of strawberry and vanilla.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Strawberry Pisco Sour
drinkName.about: Like the traditional Pisco Sour? You’ll really love this fruit-filled take on the classic.

mix.how: Add pisco, lime juice and the strawberry-rose syrup to a blender and add two scoops of ice.
Blend for 20 seconds.
Add egg white and blend again for five to 10 seconds.
Strain through a coarse strainer into glasses.

drinkName.name: Cosmopolitan 1934
drinkName.about: With some homemade raspberry syrup and NOLET’S Finest Gin, you can take this classic to the next level.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into a large coupe.
Garnish with zest from a flamed orange peel and a dehydrated orange wheel (a fresh orange wheel can also be used).

drinkName.name: Spiced Apple Fizz
drinkName.about: In this cocktail from all-star New York mixologist Naren Young, ZU pairs wonderfully with pear brandy, cider, fresh lemon juice and honey syrup. You’ll crave this delightful drink on boiling hot afternoons.

mix.how: Add all ingredients (except the cider) to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass over fresh ice.
Top with hard apple cider and garnish with an apple fan and fresh grated cinnamon.

drinkName.name: The Count of Żubrówka
drinkName.about: What do you get when you combine ZU Bison Grass Vodka, Amaro Montenegro and hard apple cider? This regal cocktail, thought up by respected Denver bartender Sean Kenyon. It’s piquant and coolingboth qualities of a great summer drink. Plus, when you drink it, you’ll feel like nobility.

mix.how: Add all ingredients (except the cider) to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice.
Top with Ace Hard Apple Cider and garnish with an apple fan. .

drinkName.name: Absinthe Frappé
drinkName.about: New to absinthe? This classic cocktail is for you.

mix.how: In a cocktail shaker add the absinthe and anisette.
Fill with ice and shake well until chilled.
Strain into a julep cup filled with crushed ice.
Top with additional ice and garnish with the mint sprig.

drinkName.name: The Symphony
drinkName.about: It’s a very simple drink on all fronts, yet very complexand some might say that’s the beauty of it.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Stir then strain into the glass.

drinkName.name: The Mary Mac
drinkName.about: The botanicals of Pimms No. 1 play ping-pong with hard cider and ZU Bison Grass Vodka’s notes of vanilla and coconut to make a refreshing cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients (except the cider) to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously for 20 seconds and strain into a highball glass over fresh ice.
Top with cider.
Garnish with a cucumber slice, a blackberry, a strawberry and a blade of bison grass.

drinkName.name: Grassland Wallow
drinkName.about: Combine ZU Bison Grass Vodka with hard apple cider for a seasonal vodka cocktail that is citrusy, crisp and ultra refreshing.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the cider to a pilsner glass.
Add pebbled ice and stir until the outside of the glass frosts.
Top with more ice and the cider.
Garnish with a sprig of mint and seasonal berries.

drinkName.name: Rosé Cobbler
drinkName.about: This refreshing cocktail is low in alcohol and high in flavor.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a stemmed cobbler glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with mixed berries, a mint sprig and powdered sugar.

drinkName.name: Garden Gin & Tonic
drinkName.about: This Gin & Tonic is summer in a glass.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the tonic to a goblet or wine glass and fill with fresh ice.
Top with tonic water and garnish with grapefruit and lemon wheels, cucumber slices, strawberries and a lavender sprig.

drinkName.name: Bee’s Knees
drinkName.about: Gin, lemon juice and honey create a buzz-worthy cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

*Honey syrup: Add 1/2 cup honey and 1/2 cup water to a small saucepan over medium heat. (You can experiment and decide how much of a honey flavor you want in your syrup. The more honey you use, the thicker the syrup and stronger in flavor it will be.) Stir until blended. Strain into a jar and seal tightly with a lid. Will keep for 1 month in the refrigerator.

drinkName.name: RumChata on the Rocks
drinkName.about: There’s no easier way to drink RumChata than on the rocks.

mix.how: Pack a rocks glass with ice and add RumChata.

drinkName.name: RumChata Martini
drinkName.about: You’ll savor every flavorful sip of this Martini.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Root Beer Float
drinkName.about: Try RumChata’s take on the classic Root Beer Float.

ingredients.ingredient: Root beer (A&W or Dad’s Root Beer)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a Rocks glass filled with fresh ice and stir to combine.

drinkName.name: Mint ChocoChata
drinkName.about: RumChata + chocolate + mint = dessert in a glass.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with chocolate chips or chocolate shavings.

drinkName.name: RumChata Iced Coffee
drinkName.about: Get your morning fix with a kick.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Kyuuri Hana
drinkName.about: This cocktail from Shari Sushi Lounge in Orlando, Fla. mixes gin, mint and cucumber for an extra-refreshing libation.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part water, one part sugar)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with three cucumber slices.

drinkName.name: Two-Step Easy Brandied Cherries
drinkName.about: You won’t find a simpler recipe for flavor-packed brandied cherries.

mix.how: Drain the liquid from the contents of the jar of cherries by suspending a strainer over a container or bowl.
Dis­card the liquid (or save it to use in another drink) and return the cherries to the jar.
Add the cognac, amaretto and maraschino liqueur.
Reseal the jar and shake gently to combine the ingredients.
Add a label with the date and store the jar in the fridge for at least one month before using.

drinkName.name: Daniel Shoemaker’s Brandied Cherries
drinkName.about: These flavorful brandied cherries are worth the extra work.

mix.how: Clear away anything that you don't want to get spattered with cherry juice.
It sprays and it stains, even when you're careful, so wear an old t-shirt.
Pull off the stems and punch out the pits of the cherries with a cherry pitter.
Bring to a simmer, stirring just until the sugar is dis­solved.
Add the spice bundle and continue to simmer for about 5 minutes. Add the cherries.
Using the slotted spoon, stir the cherries until they are all soaked in the syrup and are thor­oughly warmed.
(You don't want to actually cook the cherries, just let them absorb the syrup.) Return the liquid and cherries to a simmer and pour in the brandy, rum, and bourbon, stirring to mix.
When the liquid is warmed through, remove the pot from the heat.

(Be sure not to boil the liquid because you don't want to cook off too much alcohol.) Using a wide-mouth funnel or jar filler and a slotted spoon, pack each canning jar with cherries, filling it to the top.
Give the jar a good tap on the counter to settle the fruit so there are minimal air gaps.
Ladle the hot syrup into the jars up to about half an inch from the rim.
Place the flat part of the lid on the jar, and screw the band on lightly.
Allow them to cool and let the seals form properly.
You'll hear a nice pop as the vacuum forms and the lid is sucked down.
Tighten the rings of all the jars that have sealed properly.

drinkName.name: Santa Catarina Shandy
drinkName.about: Shandies and other simple beer cocktails are popular in Germany, where they are called Biermischgetränke.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (2 parts honey, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add the cachaça, lemon juice and honey syrup to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass.
Add 5 or 6 ice cubes to the glass and top with beer, pouring gently so it doesn't foam over.
Stir briefly and garnish with a few grinds of pink peppercorn.

drinkName.name: Tea & C Time
drinkName.about: This drink combines England’s deep history and ties with tea with the Brazilian sugarcane spirit cachaça.

ingredients.ingredient: Earl Grey tea syrup (1 part sugar, 1 part brewed Earl Grey tea)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and shake without ice.
Fill with ice, shake again and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda.

drinkName.name: The Pineapple Mint Caipirinha
drinkName.about: Try this recipe for an extra summery twist on the classic Caipirinha.

mix.how: Muddle the pineapple, mint and sugar in a shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and add Leblon Cachaça.
Shake vigorously.
Serve in a rocks glass.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

drinkName.name: Peppermint Tea Syrup
drinkName.about: This easy-to-make peppermint syrup is a versatile base for spring entertaining.

mix.how: In a saucepan, bring the water to a boil.
Add peppermint tea bags and steep for 3 minutes.
Remove the tea bags and add the sugar, stirring until it dissolves.
Let the syrup cool; it can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

drinkName.name: Bone Machine
drinkName.about: Try this bourbon and sherry creation from a top San Francisco bartender.

mix.how: In a mixing glass filled with ice, add the bourbon, sherry, amaro, Bénédictine, and both bitters and stir.
Strain into an old- fashioned glass filled with one large ice cube.
Flame the orange peel over the glass and add.
Serve.

drinkName.name: Greenhouse
drinkName.about: This tequila cocktail made with snap pea shrub and mint is a true culinary masterpiece.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake very hard and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Green Margarita
drinkName.about: This twist on the classic Margarita recipe uses a delicious sugar snap pea puree.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Spring 2014
drinkName.about: This cocktail combines spring flavors like lemon thyme, verjus and sugar snap peas.

ingredients.ingredient: Maldon salt or other sea salt

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the pea pods.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a large coupe glass.
Garnish with a sprig of lemon thyme resting across the rim.

drinkName.name: Green Giant
drinkName.about: Prepare to be hit with a wave of perfect spring refreshment.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the pea pods, tarragon and simple syrup.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine-strain into a frozen rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with 2 sugar snap pea pods.

drinkName.name: Grasshopper
drinkName.about: The Grasshopper cocktail is a minty classic that is better than your traditional dessert.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Grate fresh nutmeg directly over the center of the drink.

drinkName.name: Holy Guac-a-Mary
drinkName.about: Tequila and tomatillo “salsa” take this Bloody Mary to Mexico.

mix.how: Add the tequila to a Collins glass.
Fill glass with crushed or pebble ice, add the tomatillo salsa mixture and stir well.
Garnish with a tomatillo wheel.

drinkName.name: Grilled Shrimp Tacos with Corn Salsa
drinkName.about: Looking for something quick and easy to whip up with your Margarita this Cinco de Mayo? Say hello to your new favorite taco recipe, with grilled shrimp, avocado and a corn salsa that makes the flavors pop.

ingredients.ingredient: large shrimp, peeled and deveined with tails removed
finely chopped cilantro, plus more for garnish
Juice of lime, plus lime wedges for garnish

mix.how: Serves 6 (about 2 tacos per serving).
Prep time: 10 minutes, plus 30 minutes in refrigerator.
Total time: 45 minutes.
Pat the shrimp dry with a paper towel and skewer close together.
Combine 1/4 cup olive oil, half the garlic and half the cilantro in a small bowl.
Brush the oil mixture onto both sides of the shrimp, and season well with salt and black pepper.
Refrigerate uncovered for at least 30 minutes.
To make the salsa, combine the corn, red onion, tomato, jalapeño, honey and lime juice in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
To make the avocado crema, smash together the avocado, sour cream and lemon. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Combine the remaining olive oil, garlic and cilantro in a large mixing bowl.

Place the chilled skewers a few inches apart onto a hot grill, and cook for about 3 minutes (until the bottom has begun to char), then flip. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, until shrimp are plump and bright. Remove from the grill, and slide them off of the skewer and into the olive oil and garlic mix. Toss to coat.

Heat tortillas on the grill for about 2 minutes on each side. To assemble tacos, pile a bit of the corn salsa into each tortilla, followed by the shrimp, a dollop of avocado crema, cilantro and a squeeze of lime. Serve.

drinkName.name: New York Sour
drinkName.about: Top a classic Whiskey Sour with red wine to get this delicious pre-Prohibition tipple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the wine to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Carefully pour the wine over the back of a spoon so it floats on top of the drink.

drinkName.name: Lemon Drop
drinkName.about: The Lemon Drop first squeezed to life in San Francisco sometime during the 1970s. Its inventor, Norman Jay Hobday, an out-of-work Vietnam vet turned saloon owner, is also credited with opening the country’s first fern bar, a concept that mixed house plants and Tiffany lamps with throngs of upwardly mobile urbanites.

ingredients.ingredient:
Vodka
Try it with Absolut Citron

mix.how: Coat the rim of a cocktail glass with sugar and set aside (do this a few minutes ahead of time so the sugar can dry and adhere well to the glass).
Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Louisville Jockey Club Julep
drinkName.about: This banana puree julep doesn’t monkey around.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a Julep cup filled with ice.
Swizzle, and top with crushed ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Bananarac
drinkName.about: The New Orleans classic Sazerac gets a clever upgrade with banana liqueur.

ingredients.ingredient: The Bitter Truth Old Time Aromatic Bitters

mix.how: Pour a little absinthe into a chilled rocks glass.
Swirl to coat the inside, discard any excess and set the glass aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the prepared glass.
Twist a swatch of lemon peel over the drink and discard.

drinkName.name: Iz Bananaz
drinkName.about: Try this zippy cachaça-based banana drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and add a single ice cube.
Shake briefly to mix and strain into a Collins glass filled with pebble ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Dirty Oaxacan Martini
drinkName.about: Mezcal in a Martini? Try this olive juice-spiked concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: Del Maguey Santo Domingo Albarradas mezcal

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with Kalamata olives.

drinkName.name: Trato Hecho
drinkName.about: The classic Last Word cocktail goes south of the border.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Blackberry Mint Julep Margarita
drinkName.about: Celebrate Cinco de Mayo and the Kentucky Derby at the same time.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (one part honey, one part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blackberries and mint.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Julep cup filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with blackberries and a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Girls Next Door
drinkName.about: Inspired by spring, this fruity vodka drink combines floral and strawberry flavors.

ingredients.ingredient: Pear liqueur (such as Merlet Crème de Poire William)

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker, and dry-shake (without ice).
Fill with ice, shake again, and strain into a coupe glass.
Spritz the top of the drink with lemon bitters in a spray bottle or atomizer.

drinkName.name: Green & Amber
drinkName.about: Bring together East & West in the form of Scotch whisky and Japanese green tea.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (one part honey, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a Collins glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Ascot
drinkName.about: The Ascot is a sophisticated sipping cocktail, smooth in texture but worldly in manner.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.

drinkName.name: White Dragon
drinkName.about: Try this lemon twist on the classic Margarita, with an egg white for extra richness.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice.
Fill with ice, shake again and strain into a coupe glass.
Twist a swatch of orange peel over the drink and discard.

drinkName.name: Cacao Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: A delicious chocolate-flavored rum is the base for this spin on the classic.

mix.how: In an Old Fashioned glass, muddle the sugar, bitters and a splash of club soda.
Fill with ice and add the rum.
Stir, and garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Cafe Panama
drinkName.about: This coffee-chocolate-rum drink is tasty hot or cold.

ingredients.ingredient: Espresso, cold-brew or other strong brewed coffee

mix.how: To serve hot, add all the ingredients to a small saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring, until hot.
Pour into a mug and garnish with a cinnamon stick.To serve cold, add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice.
Stir, and garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Improved Bronx
drinkName.about: Make the classic gin cocktail better by replacing orange juice with tangerine.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Ten Aviation
drinkName.about: Take flight with this gin classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: Ten French 75
drinkName.about: Break out the bubbly for this classic cocktail.

mix.how: Add the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Fill with Champagne and garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Ten Southside Fizz
drinkName.about: Refresh yourself with this fizzy gin tipple.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint, lime juice and simple syrup.
Add the gin and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice.
Stir until frost appears on the outside of the glass.
Fill with club soda and garnish with another mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Ten Negroni
drinkName.about: This gin classic (and bartender favorite) is bitter and sweet.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir to combine.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Head of Steam
drinkName.about: This combination of Irish whiskey, vermouth and sherry will get you going.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Twist a piece of orange peel over the drink to express the oils and discard.

drinkName.name: 50/50 Martini
drinkName.about: Go heavy on the vermouth for this tasty variation on the classic Martini.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Perfect Ten Martini
drinkName.about: It only takes one ingredient to make this classic a perfect ten. Tanqueray No. Ten is distilled with whole citrus instead of dried citrus peel, and includes grapefruit, orange and lime, along with juniper, coriander and a hint of chamomile. Don’t forget the perfect garnish to match: a grapefruit twist.

mix.how: Add the gin to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a wide grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Mimosa
drinkName.about: Bring elegance to any brunch.

mix.how: Add the orange juice to a Champagne flute.
Fill with sparkling wine.

drinkName.name: Ten Rickey
drinkName.about: This classic gin drink is simple and refreshing.

mix.how: Add the gin, lime juice and sour mix to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the club soda and garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Bramble #10
drinkName.about: Looking to get a little fruity? Try this blackberry-and-gin cocktail.

mix.how: Add the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Drizzle the crème de mûre on top and garnish with a blackberry and a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Bourbon Rickey
drinkName.about: Though its cousin the Gin Rickey is more common today, this classic cocktail recipe can also be made with bourbon.

mix.how: Fill a highball glass with cracked ice.
Squeeze the lime half into the glass and drop it in.
Add the bourbon and fill with club soda.
Stir briefly to combine.

drinkName.name: No. 3 Gin Martini
drinkName.about: It doesn’t get more elegant than a classic gin Martini.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Black Widow
drinkName.about: Don’t fear: This crimson cocktail gets its bite from bold blanco tequila, not venom. Agave nectar and muddled blackberries soften that bite with a hint of sweetness, and give the Black Widow its signature spooky hue. Don’t forget the fresh basil and blackberry garnish for the full effect. Its bite brings pleasure, not pain.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blackberries and basil.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a stemless Martini glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a blackberry and basil leaf on a toothpick.

drinkName.name: Café Corrección Ponche
drinkName.about: This rum punch plays off cold-brew coffee’s bright orange-peel and spice flavors.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a large bowl or pitcher, muddle the sugar and orange peel.
Let stand for an hour or so to extract the oils.
Add the remaining ingredients and a little cracked ice.
Stir, and strain into a punch bowl filled with a large ice block.
Top with a sprinkling of ground cinnamon.
Serve in teacups, garnished with cinnamon sticks cracked in half the long way.

drinkName.name: Mudslide
drinkName.about: The Mudslide is a decadent mix of vodka, Kahlua and Bailey’s Irish Cream. Perfect for sipping in warm weather, this frozen cocktail is rich, sweet and very, very cold. This summer, ditch your cocktail shaker, bust out the blender and knock back this creamy concoction.

ingredients.ingredient:
Coffee liqueur
Try it with Kahlúa

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour the Mudslide into a Martini or Hurricane glass.
If desired, drizzle with chocolate syrup.

drinkName.name: The Zapatero
drinkName.about: This mezcal-spiked spin on the classic Old Fashioned cocktail is a south-of-the-border delight.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with grated cinnamon, an orange twist and a Lounge Attire Cocktail Cranberry.

drinkName.name: Smokin’ Mary
drinkName.about: Love savory flavors? Four different smoky ingredients combine in a tasty liqueur that’s the base for this Bloody Mary variation.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a pint glass filled with ice and stir to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Blushing Spritzer
drinkName.about: Make your own hibiscus-rose liqueur for this bubbly refresher that’s perfect for an afternoon picnic.

mix.how: Place one large ice cube in a wine glass and add all the ingredients.
Stir, and garnish with 3 rose petals or 6 pomegranate arils.
